sections: Tom Mack has once again picked Motorious to host their first 2021 auction!

In a historic move in the auction industry, Tom Mack trusted Motorious to host their first online auction in history in June of 2020, and now it's happening again! As a result of ongoing restrictions and public health concerns, combined with the massive interest and results, Tom Mack has decided to open their auction up to internet bidding once again.
Starting Saturday, January 9th, 2021, you can bid right here on Motorious in the Tom Mack Classics Fall Online Auctions. The bidding is underway, with lots closing a week later.
Here is a small taste of what you'll have the opportunity to bid on once you sign up:

Presently undergoing cosmetic restoration by a restorer in Georgia. North Carolina original car with 265 power pac V8 and 3-Speed manual transmission. The previous owner had it from the 1980’s. Solid always-garaged Chevy that runs and drives great. Cosmetic restoration includes replated bumpers, new weatherstripping, all chrome moldings removed and refinished, new glass and door handles, new paint in the correct original colors of India Ivory and Nassau Blue. Buyer is going to be happy with this Chevy!

Original Light Pewter Metallic with original Gray leather seating, 5.7-liter V8, 5-Speed manual transmission. Always garaged and never smoked in, only 41K actual miles since new. Comes with the original window sticker, SLP Letter of Authenticity , and original manuals.  It is very hard to find one of these in this original condition.

This beautiful Impala SS is covered in Tuxedo Black, with Red bucket seat interior. The factory 4-speed transmission with console backs the 327/300 horsepower engine. A lot of restoration effort has gone into this full-size Chevy, so don't miss out!

Correct older restoration that won the prestigious AACA National first place Award and the badge is on the radiator.  Resplendent in Dawn Gray and Balsam Green with black fenders. Correct Saddle interior and black top & top boot.  Car is complete with a trunk.

Check out this un-restored original Firethorn Red paint, with patina 1976 Trans Am. This 'Bird is equipped with the desirable 455 cubic-inch V8, backed by a 4-speed manual transmission, posi rear, factory air, custom interior, bucket seats and console with rear seat console, and space saver spare tire with the original canister.

This is a solid truck from the North Carolina/Georgia mountains, and has a freshly built 360ci V8, bored to approximately 390ci with 3-speed “on the tree” manual transmission. Pretty Caribbean Turquoise with matching interior. Original owner card & NC title from 1964 are included with the sale of this special truck. Truck runs & drives great, and is super peppy with the fresh V-8. Drive or show this southern beauty.

Representing the 60's era well is this red-on-red XL Convertible is powered by a 390 V8. It is equipped with a dual exhaust and has a factory 4-speed manual transmission. This Galaxie runs and drives great and has the original spare tire and jack.
